bug.short_desc: Timeline functionality (see diffs & detail for a changeset)

long_desc.thetext:
We'd really like to be able to replace Trac's source browser/search with OpenGrok, but perhaps the last major feature we're missing is an equivalent to Trac's timeline functionality. This presents a history view of the entire repo. OpenGrok does this to the extent that /source/history/ works to display the changeset history for the entire repository.
What's missing is a way to see the entire detail for a changeset, most importantly the diffs for all the files affected. Right now, going to: http://hq.songbirdnest.com:8080/source/history/ shows the whole repo... clicking on the individual files for a particular revision pulls up the file at that revision which is great, but what I'd really like to see is two things: * individual link should link to a diff at that rev and the rev prior * the revision # should be a link that shows an aggregate diff for the entire changeset (e.g. all the files affected by that changeset, diff'd for that rev and the rev prior)
I'd like to see this implemented as well, in particular as a mode when searching the History (say I'd like to see the diffs for particular CR/bug). This would help tremendously when doing backports.

Thinking about this feature more, this can also be done on a per-file basis, where a sequence of diffs for a particular file would be displayed.
So, this tracks 3 features: - per project timeline - per CR timeline (or rather per History search) - per file timeline
where 'timeline' means sequence of diffs. Obviously, those 3 could be split into 3 separate RFEs.
Also, the diff view should be switchable at least between sdiff/udiff/text view.

I'm interested in seeing this implemented as well. I would be interested in working on it, if someone else starts things off; I don't have any experience with JSP, so I can't get off the ground easily.
